byline.contributor: Jeffrey Moyo reported from Harare, and Norimitsu Onishi from Johannesburg.
byline.original: By JEFFREY MOYO and NORIMITSU ONISHI

abstract: Zimbabwean police crack down on protest against Pres Robert Mugabe in capital of Harare, despite last-minute court order allowing demonstration to proceed; swiftness and force of response points to escalating tensions amid widespread unrest and collapsing economy.
lead_paragraph: Despite a last-minute court order allowing a demonstration, the police used violent means to disperse hundreds protesting against President Robert Mugabe.
snippet: Despite a last-minute court order allowing a demonstration, the police used violent means to disperse hundreds protesting against President Robert Mugabe....

headline.main: Police in Zimbabwe Hit Protesters With Batons, Tear Gas and Water Cannons
headline.print_headline: Police in Zimbabwe Quell an Opposition Protest With Batons and Tear Gas
